edu.stanford.math.plex4.examples

Class PointCloudExamples

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.examples.PointCloudExamples

  • public class PointCloudExamples
extends java.lang.Object
    This static class contains various functions which produce examples of point cloud data sets.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      • getRandomSpherePoints

        public static double[][] getRandomSpherePoints(int n,
                               int d)
        This function returns n uniformly random point on the d-dimensional sphere as a subset of R^{d+1}.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of points to generate
        d - the dimension of the sphere to generate on
        Returns:
        n points in (d+1)-dimensional Euclidean space uniformly distributed on the d-sphere

      • getGaussianPoints

        public static double[][] getGaussianPoints(int n,
                           int d)
        This function returns n points distributed to a standard Gaussian distribution in d-dimensional Euclidean space.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of points to generate
        d - the dimension of the space to generate in
        Returns:
        n Gaussian points in R^d

      • getRandomTorusPoints

        public static double[][] getRandomTorusPoints(int n,
                              double r,
                              double R)
        This function returns non-uniformly generated points on the torus in R^3.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of points to generate
        r - the inner radius
        R - the outer radius
        Returns:
        randomly generated points on the torus in R^3

      • getRandomTrefoilKnotPoints

        public static double[][] getRandomTrefoilKnotPoints(int n)

      • getRandomSphereProductPoints

        public static double[][] getRandomSphereProductPoints(int numPoints,
                                      int sphereDimension,
                                      int numFactors)
        This function returns uniformly distributed points on the space S^k x ... x S^k. Special cases of this include the 2-torus S^1 x S^1 in R^4, as well as the sphere S^k.
        Parameters:
        numPoints - the number of points to generate
        sphereDimension - the sphere dimension (ie. the k in S^k x ... x S^k)
        numFactors - the number of factors in the product S^k x ... x S^k
        Returns:
        uniformly generated points on the set S^k x ... x S^k

      • getRandomFigure8Points

        public static double[][] getRandomFigure8Points(int n)
        This function returns randomly generated points on a figure-8 in the plane. This consists of two circles - one translated up by 1 unit, and the other translated down by 1 unit.
        Parameters:
        n - the number of points to generate
        Returns:
        randomly generated points on a figure-8.

        public static double[][] getDisjointPatches(int n)
